page.title: 01SOUTH DERBYSHIRE
page.content: The block 0424315 lies in the far south of Derbyshire,close to the main trunk roads the A444,A38 & A50.These roads provide easy access to many of the larger towns in the Midlands.Also the main N.E to S.W railway lines runs through Burton-on-Trent five miles away.It is very rural area containing the villages of Linton,Coton in the Elms,Rosliston,Coton Park & Caldwell. There is a strong sense of developed community spirit which has grown up through coalmining traditions.Some of the "pits" are still open today and employ many fathers,but the population tend to travel to Burton to work in the brewery and associated industries or the power station at Drakelow. Housing is a mixture of private and council properties ranging in price range and age some being extremely old.
